title: Lonacort 1ML Inf

precautions: Before using triamcinolone, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or to other corticosteroids (such as methylprednisolone); or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. Using corticosteroid medications for a long time can make it more difficult for your body to respond to physical stress. Therefore, before having surgery or emergency treatment, or if you get a serious illness/injury, tell your doctor or dentist that you are using this medication or have used this medication within the past 12 months. Tell your doctor right away if you develop unusual/extreme tiredness or weight loss. If you will be using this medication for a long time, carry a warning card or medical ID bracelet that identifies your use of this medication. This medication may mask signs of infection. It can make you more likely to get infections or may worsen any current infections. Avoid contact with people who have infections that may spread to others (such as chickenpox, measles, flu). Consult your doctor if you have been exposed to an infection or for more details. It is unknown if this medication passes into breast milk. Consult your doctor before breast-feeding. Ask your pharmacist or healthcare provider before using any medicine.

title: Sandostatin 0.05MG Inj 1x5 (L)
details:

precautions: The essential Sandostatin injection preventive measures are described below. It is recommended to read them to avoid any harmful effects.Do not administer the Sandostatin injection if you are hypersensitive to octreotide or inactive ingredients.Inform your doctor of your medical history, previous allergies, and a list of medications you are already using.Use the injection on a doctor's prescription if you are suffering from gallstones or have symptoms associated with it.Inform your physician if your blood sugar level is disturbed. In diabetes or hypoglycemia, it is essential to monitor blood glucose levels regularly.Do not use the injection without the doctor’s recommendation if you have any heart issues, as the medication can cause irregular heart rhythm.Notify your doctor in case of vitamin B12 deficiency.Notify your doctor in case you are suffering from liver cirrhosis.Keep periodic monitoring of liver functioning and thyroid functioning.Notify your doctor if you are already taking the medication to treat hypertension, diabetes, or beta-blockers.The Sandostatin injection must be administered on the doctor’s recommendation if you are pregnant or planning to be.Do not use the injection if you are breastfeeding.Keep the medication far from the children’s reach.Store it in a cool, dry, and safe place.Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Kidney disease, Cirrhosis, Diabetes, Thyroid problems, Gallstones, Decreased fat absorption, Vitamin B12 deficiency. During pregnancy, this medication should be used only when clearly needed.
